description: This data was generated from the TARGET program data in June 2018. It contains clinical and biospecimen sample data for patient cases.

fields.description: The barcode of the TARGET case (participant) for this sample.
fields.name: case_barcode

fields.description: TARGET sample barcode, e.g. TARGET-20-PASWAT-09A
fields.name: sample_barcode

fields.description: GDC unique identifier for this case (corresponds to the case_barcode)  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal like this:   https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/files/c21b332c-06c6-4403-9032-f91c8f407ba9
fields.name: case_gdc_id

fields.description: Unique GDC identifier for this sample (corresponds to the sample_barcode), eg a1ec9279-c1a6-4e58-97ed-9ec1f36187c5  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal
fields.name: sample_gdc_id

fields.description: Project name abbreviation; the TARGET program is composed of multiple projects, with abbreviations such as TARGET-ALL-P2, TARGET-AML, TARGET-WT, etc.
fields.name: project_short_name

fields.description: Project Name; frequently the same as or similar to the project disease type eg   Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia - Phase II   or   Breast Invasive Carcinoma   etc
fields.name: project_name

fields.description: Program Name, always TARGET (Therapeutically Applicable Research To Generate Effective Treatments) in this table.
fields.name: program_name

fields.description: A code representing the type of cancer. Values can be found at https://gdc.cancer.gov/resources-TCGA-users/TCGA-code-tables/TCGA-study-abbreviations; eg. OV, GBM, LUAD
fields.name: disease_code

fields.description: Participant gender; e.g. Male, Female
fields.name: gender

fields.description: Two-digit sample_type code which forms part of the sample barcode eg. 01,11,06, etc.
fields.name: sample_type

fields.description: The race of a participant, independent from ethnicity; e.g. White, Black or African American, Asian, Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander, American Indian or Alaska Native
fields.name: race

fields.description: Survival state of the participant; e.g. dead, alive
fields.name: vital_status

fields.description: The ethnic origination of a participant, independent from race; e.g. Not Hispanic or Latino, Hispanic or Latino
fields.name: ethnicity

fields.description: Age, in years, at which a condition or disease was first diagnosed
fields.name: age_at_diagnosis

fields.description: If vital_status indicates 'alive', then this is the number of days from the date of diagnosis to the last followup (communication contact).
fields.name: days_to_last_followup

fields.description: The location on the body where the primary tumor exists; e.g. Arm/Hand, Pelvis, etc.
fields.name: primary_tumor_site

fields.description: Four digit year of the diagnosis
fields.name: year_of_diagnosis

fields.description: Days since birth (a negative value, relative to the date of diagnosis which is considered to be t=0)
fields.name: days_to_birth

fields.description: White Blood Cell count at diagnosis
fields.name: wbc_at_diagnosis

fields.description: Number of days of event free survival
fields.name: event_free_survival

fields.description: Number of days from the date of diagnosis to the last day on which a person was known to be alive. This field is a combination of the days_to_last_followup and days_to death fields. Therefore, this field can be used whether the vital_status is 'alive' or 'dead'.
fields.name: days_to_last_known_alive

fields.description: If vital_status indicates 'dead', then this is the number of days to death (a positive value) relative to the date of diagnosis.
fields.name: days_to_death
